intro: Navarretia pungens, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. Navarretia pungens is often found in disturbed areas and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
